title: ALU Scalar Instructions (xvs_3_0, xps_3_0)
html:
1 capture
25 Apr 2010
Mar APR May
25
2009 2010 2011
success
fail
About this capture
COLLECTED BY
Organization: Alexa Crawls
Starting in 1996, Alexa Internet has been donating their crawl data to the Internet Archive. Flowing in every day, these data are added to the Wayback Machine after an embargo period.
Collection: alexa_web_2010
this data is currently not publicly accessible.
TIMESTAMPS
The Wayback Machine - https://web.archive.org/web/20100425014442/http://msdn.microsoft.com:80/en-us/library/bb313879.aspx
XNA Game Studio 3.1
ALU Scalar Instructions (xvs_3_0, xps_3_0)
InstructionDescription
adds

Computes the sum of the two components of the source.

adds_prev

Computes the sum of the source and the result of the previous scalar operation.

cos

Computes the cosine of the source.

exp

Computes the base-2 exponential of the source.

floors

Computes the greatest integer that is less than or equal to the source.

frcs

Computes the fractional part of the source.

log

Computes the base-2 logarithm of the source.

logc

Computes the base-2 logarithm of the source, clamped to the range −MIN_FLOAT to +MAX_FLOAT.

maxas

Updates the address register (a0) with the first component of the source register. It then computes the maximum of the two components of the source.

maxasf

Updates the address register (a0) with the first component of the source register, floored. It then computes the maximum of the two components of the source.

maxs

Computes the maximum of the two components of the source.

mins

Computes the minimum of the two components of the source.

movas

Moves scalar data between registers and updates the address register (a0) with the source register, rounded to the nearest integer.

movasf

Moves scalar data between registers and updates the address register (a0) with the source register, floored.

movs

Moves scalar data between registers.

muls

Multiplies the two specified components of the source.

muls_prev

Computes the product of the source register and the result of the previous scalar operation.

muls_prev2

Computes the product of the source register and the result of the previous scalar operation, with bounds checking.

nops

No operation is performed on the scalar ALU.

rcp

Computes the reciprocal of the source.

rcpc

Computes the reciprocal of the source, clamped to the range −MIN_FLOAT to +MAX_FLOAT.

rcpf

Computes the reciprocal of the source, mimicking the behavior of the fixed-function pipeline.

retain_prev

Returns the result of the previous scalar instruction.

rsq

Computes the reciprocal square root of the source.

rsqc

Computes the reciprocal square root of the source, clamped to the range −MIN_FLOAT to +MAX_FLOAT.

rsqf

Computes the reciprocal square root of the source, mimicking the behavior of the fixed-function pipeline.

seqs

Sets the destination components equal to one if the source is zero.

sges

Sets the destination components equal to one if the source is greater than or equal to zero.

sgts

Sets the destination components equal to one if the source is greater than zero.

sin

Computes the sine of the source.

snes

Sets the destination components equal to one if the source is nonzero.

sqrt

Computes the square root of the source.

subs

Computes the difference between the two specified components of the source.

subs_prev

Computes the difference of the source register and the result of the previous scalar operation.

truncs

Truncates the source.

See Also

Concepts

Microcode (xvs_3_0, xps_3_0)

adds_prev (xvs_3_0, xps_3_0)
cos (xvs_3_0, xps_3_0)

logc (xvs_3_0, xps_3_0)

maxasf (xvs_3_0, xps_3_0)
